January 18, 2025 · GUIDE

AI Website Builder Pricing: The True Cost

The advertised prices look reasonable. But add up hidden costs, long-term commitments, and lock-in—suddenly you're paying far more than expected. Here's what these tools actually cost over 1-3 years.

Advertised vs reality

Tool Monthly Price 3-Year Total
Framer (Basic) $15/mo $540
Framer (Pro with export) $25/mo $900
Durable $12/mo $432
10Web (Premium) $10/mo $360
WordPress self-hosted $3-10/mo $108-360

The hidden costs

Framer: Export isn't included

Advertised as $15/month. But export—the feature that lets you actually own your code—costs $25/month. Need export? Budget $900 for 3 years, not $540. And even then, the exported code depends on Framer's ecosystem. You're not getting clean React code.

Durable: You can never leave

$12/month sounds cheap. And it is the cheapest upfront. But Durable has zero export options at any price. You're locked into their hosting forever. If you stop paying, your site disappears. That's not ownership, that's renting.

10Web: WordPress overhead

$10/month for the AI builder. But WordPress has hidden costs: premium plugins ($50-200/year each), premium themes ($50-150/year), and hosting that scales with traffic. Your $10/month becomes $30-60/month quickly.

Relume: Not a standalone builder

Free for 3 projects, $20/month for unlimited. But Relume doesn't host your site—you need Figma, Framer, or Webflow to actually build. You're paying for planning, not the final product. Total cost: Relume + your builder of choice.

When the extra cost is worth it

Sometimes paying the AI builder premium makes sense:

  • Speed to market: Launching in days vs months is worth $180-300/year for most businesses
  • No developers: If you don't have $5,000-20,000 for custom development, AI builders are the only option
  • Frequent iteration: Need to make changes constantly? AI builders let you edit in minutes. Custom sites require dev time
  • Testing: Trying 10 different landing pages? AI builders make this trivial. Custom building would be prohibitive

When it doesn't make sense

Paying the AI builder premium when you don't need to:

  • Simple static sites: Hugo/Astro + free hosting costs $0-30/year total
  • Long-term projects: $15/month for 5 years = $900. Could hire a developer once for that price
  • High-volume: Building 10+ sites? $15/month per site adds up fast

Bottom line

AI website builders aren't cheap long-term. Three years of any AI builder costs $360-900 minimum. WordPress or custom code has higher upfront cost but lower ongoing costs.

The right choice depends on your timeline, budget, and long-term plans. Calculate the 3-year cost before committing—that's the true price, not the advertised monthly fee.
